definition: to second a motion
variant of 附[fu4]
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
to comment on/to discuss/to suggest

sentences.english: He seconded the motion to increase membership fees.
sentences.chinese: 他附议增加会员费的动议。

sentences.english: Everyone seconded the proposal, and it was carried unanimously.
sentences.chinese: 这项提案大家都附议，并一致通过。

sentences.english: Any proposal must be seconded by two other members of the committee.
sentences.chinese: 任何提案须有委员会其他两名议员附议。

sentences.english: The proposer, seconder and candidates must not be disqualified at the date of nomination.
sentences.chinese: 提议人，附议人及候选人在提名时必须具有会员资格。

sentences.english: A motion was made, seconded and passed to accept the resignation of Mr. Smith.
sentences.chinese: 接受史密施先生辞职的提议，经附议表决后通过。

sentences.english: The original motion has to be seconded before it can be amended in discussion.
sentences.chinese: 原来的动议必须有人附议后，才可以再被修改。

sentences.english: I second Xiao Li's motion that we set up a special board to tackle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 小李提议成立一个特别委员会处理此问题，我附议。

sentences.english: All right, the motion has been seconded. Is there any discussion?
sentences.chinese: 很好，这项动议已经有人附议。还有其他的意见吗？

definition: to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)
to parrot other people's words (idiom); to chime in with others
(military) to leave one's place in the ranks/to fall out/(fig.) to emerge/to become prominent
to approve of/to endorse/(vote) in favor
to approve of/to endorse/(vote) in favor
centrist/the centrist faction
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to promise/to agree to do sth
reasonable/justified/right/(math.) rational
reasonable/sensible
advice/to advise
to follow your orders/to do as you bid
to put forward a suggestion (to sb in a senior position)/to offer a word of advice
to obey the Emperor's decree/at your Imperial majesty's command
to make a suggestion/to state (one's views, ideas etc)/suggestion/advice/idea
to give a nod of approval
all of one voice/unanimous
